text: now the West Indies batsman Chris Gayle
has been fined around 5,000 pounds for
making inappropriate comments to a
female cricket presenter in a live TV
interview during a match in Australia
he's playing for Melbourne renegades in
the twenty20 Big Bash League and whom he
asked channel tens Mel McLaughlin for a
date saying to see your eyes for the
first time his nights hopefully we can
have a drink afterwards he told her not
to blush returning from the match in
Hobart he spoke to the media at
Melbourne Airport today and said it was
a simple joke but he has apologised
there wasn't anything meant to be
disrespectful
or offended to know and if she felt that
way you know then I'm really sorry for
that there wasn't any harm you know
meant in that particular way you no harm
any particular person in any particular
way like that and it was a simple joke
the game was going on entertainment you
know things get out of proportion and
about these things do happen so it
wasn't any harm done and like I said
I'll leave it at that and you know I'm
sorry for that and then you know just
have to move on simple I like just going
about my business and doing my job but
definitely a good thing that people are
talking and you know we want equality we
always want equality and i I've always
felt in my career I've felt nothing but
respect and he did issue an apology and
I accept that and we just move on don't
expect to get that sort of answer and a
little bit disappointing
